p: Clinical analysis of COVID-19 patients admitted to a hospital in Wuhan, China reported that patients showed elevated plasma concentrations of other cytokines including TNF-α, IL-7, IL1β, INFγ, IL1RA and MIP1A/B. Moreover, cytokine levels were higher in patients admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) [ 84]. Tumor necrosis factor-α (TNF-α) is an inflammatory cytokine secreted by activated monocyte/macrophages as part of innate immune system and is directly correlated with COVID-19 disease severity ( R = −0.322, p < 0.001) [ 85]. Although targeting TNF-α is rational and appealing, the clinical efficacy of anti-TNF antibodies (e.g., adalimumab) for SARS-CoV-2 infected patients needs further investigation [ 86].
